content: broken rib socks amy vanwell designs description a cuff-down two-at-a time taat sock pattern designed for magic loop these techniques are simple by themselves however the combination can be a bit tricky © 2020 amy van well designs all rights reserved it is illegal to sell the pattern in part or in whole electronically or physically size s m l corresponding to 6 7 8 sock circumference materials ● fingering weight yarn i used ancient arts socknado divided into two equal skeins about 54g each ● us 2 circular needles 30 length ● tapestry needle ● measuring tape/ruler ● extra us 2 needle double-pointed ● scissors gauge 32st = 4 in the round in the broken rib pattern page 4 abbreviations co - cast on k - knit p - purl stst = stockinette stitch sl = slip_stitch purlwise k2tog = knit two stitches together p2tog = purl two stitches together ssk = slip two stitches knitwise knit the slipped stitches together rs = right side ws = wrong side © 2020 amy van well designs all rights reserved it is illegal to sell the pattern in part or in whole electronically or physically start of instructions cast on / cuff to co for knitting two socks at once use the long-tail co and start by co 28 32 36 stitches for sock a using the first skein then push these stitches down the needle using the second skein separately co 56 64 72 stitches for sock b pull the wire through the center of sock b so that its stitches are evenly divided across the two sides of the circular wire co 28 32 74 more stitches for sock a using the first skein so that its stitches are also evenly distributed across the two needles to join in the round with the needles facing to the right pull the back needle out and grab the yarn for sock a without twisting the stitches k1p1 across the first 28 32 36 stitches for sock a slide this half down the right needle and grab the yarn for sock b then k1p1 across the first 28 32 36 stitches for sock b turn the needles around so they re facing to the right again then continue in the k1p1 pattern across the second half of sock b then the second half of sock a this is the technique you will use to knit across the socks 1st half sock a 1st half sock b second half sock b then second half sock a continue in the rib k1p1 pattern for 9 more row for a total of 10 row of rib leg the leg will be knit with the broken rib pattern on both sides of the sock broken rib pattern size s size m size l row 1- k 6p1 * repeat * row 1- k7p1 * repeat * row 1- k8p1 * repeat * eight times eight times eight times row 2- k all sts row 2- k
